If you’ve been following FoodTok, you’ve probably seen the wave of creators sharing single-serve recipes over the last few years. You might come across folks baking lasagna in mini Dutch ovens or using tiny rectangular pans to roast a leg of chicken. This cooking style is ideal for those living alone or anyone who wants to avoid having a lot of leftovers. And now, it just got even easier with Le Creuset’s new Gourmand Collection of cookware designed specifically for meals for one. 

Here’s everything to know: Le Creuset launched the new collection of cast-iron cookware in single-serve sizes on March 1, catering to folks who want to prepare delicious meals for one, the brand explained in a press release sent to The Kitchn.

Le Creuset’s new Gourmand collection includes cast-iron cookware sets made up of four pieces. You’ll find options like cocottes, braiser pans, and oval and rectangular baking pans and skillets. Prices for these sets range from $280 to $460, depending on the selection you snag.

If you’re curious about the size, the Le Creuset Gourmand pieces are all under 3 inches long, with some being as small as 1.7 inches. This makes them ideal for single-serving meals, whether you’re enjoying dinner alone or hosting friends and want to avoid dealing with leftovers.

Le Creuset recently shared the news of its Gourmand collection release on Instagram, and the fans couldn’t hold back their excitement in the comments. One person admitted, “Some people dream of mansions and fancy cars. I dream of having a full set.” Another user chimed in, saying, “Wow. This might honestly be my favorite yet!”
